intro: Marrubiastrum, commonly known as harts-tongue plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, typically growing in grassy areas and rocky habitats. Marrubiastrum species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it a unique and interesting subject in the study of plant morphology and ecology.
